text:
Hi,

I reorganized nisl to have a scikit-learn like project tree in order to benefit of all scikit learn automated tools (sphinx, nosetests...). The decoding_example.py has been put in the root so that people can run examples without having to compile or install anything.
This is still a work-in-progress but it is now stable and viewable. I made this PR so that you can comment from now on.

You can browse the working version of the generated website here : http://alexandreabraham.github.com/tutorial/

Alexandre
title: Nisl refactoring

title: Nisl refactoring

text: Nisl refactoring
title: Pull request merge from AlexandreAbraham/nilearn:master to nilearn/nilearn:master

text:
Create a scikit-learn like build tree for Nisl :

- AUTHORS.rst
- COPYING
- README.rst
- Makefile
- setup.py
+ doc
  - Makefile
  - conf.py
  - index.rst
  + sphinxext
+ nisl
  - __init__.py
+ examples

As in scikit-learn, python files starting vy plot* in the exemples
directory are compiled and the resulting plots are stored for
documentation purpose.

setup.py has been quickly tested and seems to be working.

This is still work in progress. Some information may not be up to
date.
Remove supervised clustering related stuff
Cleanup
Premier test de fetcher générique pour datasets.
Move examples to the root
Add an error message when trying to load nisl without having Numpy, Scipy and Sklearn installed.
Fix scikit learn theme
Make decoding_example work again.
Show a result image for decoding_example.py
Change "Sklearn" to "Scikit-learn" in error message

decoding_example.py : add a visualisation of the result
nisl/datastets.py : change starplus data fetching to "generic" fetcher
datasets.py : add docstrings
Add tutorial to doc-test goal. Fix tutorial to pass doctest.
Use literalinclude instead of copy/paste code.

Website related fixes
---------------------

Create .nojekyll file automatically to avoid github formatting problems.
Change the haxby picture generation for a more intersting zone.
Remove dead links in website menu.
Fix random picture shower script to handle less than 4 images.
Delete useless README.txt

Remove all remaining inappropriate references to scikit-learn
Edit tutorial to use only literalinclude of decoding_example.py
instead of code copy/paste.

Add kamitani data fetching. Data can not be downloaded for the
moment because of registering issues, but it can be loaded.

Add a test file to treat kamitani data (not very efficient).

Focus learning on the foveal zone of the picture
Learn on V1 only
List the repartition of features among each ROI
Show results per pixel and not per image in order to show that
learning is more efficient in the foveal zone
Code cleaning. Some options can now be enabled from the beginning of the file.
setup your github config as your commits appear from : aabraham@is148601.intra.cea.fr

text: Remarks on README.rst: README.txt should be removed, we shouldn't have 2 readmes, it will be confusing. The information between the t2 should be merged. Also, the right way to install locally is 'Python setup.py install --user', not '--home'
